Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs- HoliDont”
Reviews.Author: chi-guy1234
Reviews.Content: Has a 1 day lay over decided to try out this Holiday Inn. WOW was that a mistake.. This hotel was horrible. I do this in every hotel I stay at specially with the bed bug thing we've been hearing about. So I check the mattress and the head board b/c that is where these bugs are known to be found. WOW did I find bugs. I called down and reported this problem to the Manager on Duty and it took them over 30 minutes to respond so I to come to them. I pointed out to them and it seemed like they really didn't care it's like they are use to it. The manager looked @ another person in a suit and said to him "ANOTHER ROOM" how many rooms do you have like this? So we got another room on a different floor and Guess what??? This room had them too. So at this point I was like WTF. I was very upset and wanted to check out ASAP and go some where else. I was making conversation with an associate as I was waiting for the shuttle. The associate from the hotel said to me that this kind of thing happens all the time. They said that "The owners are @ fought, they don't want to fix the problem they just to put a band aide on it." Theses Indian owners just care about the money coming in and don't care about fixing the issues around the hotel." Shame on you owners,shame on you.. this is why I will no longer stay with you though I am a very loyal guest to IHG.. If you are in the O'hare are DO NOT STAY @ THE HOLIDAY INN ON CUMBERLAND, STAY @ THE ROSEMONT, THE ONE WITH HARRY CARRY'S TAVERN.. MUCH BETTER HOTEL. YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED. I will be posting the video from my experience on all sites just to make everyone aware..

Reviews.Title: “oct2011”
Reviews.Author: KathleenCK55
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel for the price,nice clean rooms. Convenient shuttle to get to the airport and ride the train to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing even with low expectations”
Reviews.Author: JLM2009
Reviews.Content: By all accounts, this property could easily be 3 stars, if not 3 stars plus, given it's pedigree. Holiday Inn is not a terribly shabby company, but I'm not expecting a Four Seasons or Marriott or even a Courtyard Marriott. However, despite my lowered expectations, I was disappointed. Honestly, if they could just fix some simple things, they would easily exceed 3 stars. Problems: 1) Shuttle took over an HOUR, not 10 minutes. Upon arrival at the airport, I called the hotel and they said a shuttle would be outside to pick me up at 9:00pm. At 8:50pm I stood outside in the below-freezing cold. No problem, really. Until 9:05 came around, and no van. 9:10pm. I call the hotel again. "He'll be there in 10 minutes." OK, the chill is setting in, whatever, still no problem. I travel enough to know this happens. 9:30 now. Ok, this is getting ridiculous. 9:40pm. 9:50pm. Finally, the shuttle rolls around at 9:55pm to pick what is now a large group of people. So he couldn't fit everyone and had to leave some who had been waiting almost as long as I had. 2) No one answers Room Service. I call for Room Service. No answer. I dial the extension and also push the 'room service button' on the phone. Rings 20 times, no answer. It is 9:30pm, but they are apparently open until 1am. I call front desk, and he says 'I'll call you back in 2 minutes, take your order, and walk it over to them.' WOW. I thought things are looking up for this hotel. Except... no call back. 10 minutes go by, I try dialing room service again, and still it just rings and rings. I call hotel operator and they say they can't help me, and just connect me to the room service line that rings and rings. I give up. 3) Wake up call never comes despite request. I ask for a wake up call at 4:00am. (but I set my alarm on my phone just in case)... my phone wakes me up just before 4:00am... and I never get awake up call. Good thing I set my phone. I unfortunately cannot speak to its amenities. Some positives: I CAN tell you that check in and check out were quick and pleasant, and the bed was comfortable. The place was clean (not new, but clean) and sanitary (unlike other small hotel chains). Free wifi, which was very nice. So really, aside from some serious service issues, this hotel is okay. I was only here overnight because of an overnight layover, but if I had to do it again, staying here makes me want to just pay a few dollars extra and head to the Grand Hyatt O'Hare.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: Holldoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to a flight out the following morning, and also because we could leave the car here free of charge for up to 14 days. I wasn't expecting much, as the price was very reasonable, but was more than pleasantly surprised at the entire experience. The room was great--extremely clean and comfortable...the general condition of the hotel was excellent, and the restaurant was a Bar Louie which we totally enjoyed. We were able to park the car under shelter and the shuttle service to and from the airport was excellent. Will definitely use this hotel again if we need to drive to Chicago for a flight. Oh, and the staff was helpful and cheerful. A very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “A place to relax”
Reviews.Author: AKVK6667
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago early morning to catch flight back to India when I realized that flight is going to be 10 hours late due to technical snag and it was touch to wait so long. I decided to go to Holiday Inn and thought of taking a good sleep but it was a good hotel and hospitality to enjoy so I had a good lunch and then a short nap before proceeding to airport in the evening. Nice place but little old style interior. rgds Ajaykumar KHANNA

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: nixforfun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just for a night in April while flying off to Dallas. The hotel was not great at all. Check in went on good but room was not in a good condition and had to get it sorted. Didnâ€™t enjoy the bed as well and had a uncomfortable night. I think the only advantage is closeness to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: Wz88
Reviews.Content: I had a serious problem upon arrival at this hotel. I have had previously called and asked if I would be able to check in earlier since I would arrive from an international flight that was really long and would be tired. The person that answered the phone said it could be arranged. However, when I arrived, the guy at the front desk was really rude and not helpful at all, made me wait almost 7 hours until I could go to a room. The room they gave me was just the most horrible hotel room I ever been at. Old AC, not working well, and the room didn't smell nice at all. I asked them to change the room, which was only arranged the NEXT day. I just did not get the hell out of this hotel because I have had paid in advance, based on previous good experience with Holiday Inn hotels in Europe. After this incident I stayed in much better hotels in the O'hare area and never intend to go back to this Holiday Inn. Also, stay away from the restaurant they have there if you can, worst breakfast ever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: Weluvdr
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to park and fly, quiet rooms, close to airport and great covered parking, we were in Mexico 12 days and car was very secure in the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Better than some of these reviews indicate”
Reviews.Author: dmbia
Reviews.Content: I am rather surprised by all the negative reviews of this property. I have stayed here numerous times, both when it has been a Holiday Inn and in its previous incarnation as a Clarion. The place is affordable, and I've never had a bad experience here. It's not the most modern decor, but the rooms have always been clean and pleasant. While it is first and foremost and airport hotel, it is also a great option for tourists arriving by car. The hotel is easily accessible from I-90 (just south of the Cumberland exit) and across the street from the Cumberland 'L' station. The train trip downtown takes about 45 minutes, but it's cheaper and easier to stay here than at most downtown hotels. There's not a lot in the immediate neighborhood, but there is a nice supermarket across I-90 and a variety of restaurants on Harlem Avenue, the next 'L' stop to the east.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Alan B
Reviews.Content: I missed my connection in Chicago having traveled 20 hours from Saudi Arabia Via London and very tired. I was booked for the next morning and sent to this hotel by American Airways. I was very supprised to find such a nice hotel and I have nothing to complain about at all. I have read the negative reviews from other posters about this hotel and all I can say is they must be confused and stayed somewhere else, definitely not at this hotel. I hope I get to stay here again on another trip in the future

Reviews.Title: “For just one night stay, it is tolerable”
Reviews.Author: uwchou
Reviews.Content: 1. There was a wedding party on the night when I was staying. After a long flight, I arrived the hotel after 12 in the midnight, and felt very tired. The guests at the party were very very noise. They occupied and crowded the elevator and totally ignored my intention to go down the the lobby. very uncomfortable. 2. Find hairs on the top of toilet and the tissue box. The bathroom is not cleaned well. 3. Airport shuttle is fine; not very close to the airport, but not too far either.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Renovation and Service Update”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: Dirty Lobby & Elevator, needs cleaning and waxed. Gym was a death trap, no one told me till my last night that you could use Bally's. Hallways are nasty, carpet was old and stained. Employees were not engaging, did not show urgency on anything, shuttle took 45 minutes to get to the airport, even after being told it was around the corner. Book some where else if possible, place needs new managment and renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: emohr79
Reviews.Content: we booked to stay here due to a special, and I've always had great experiences w/ Holiday Inn, in the past. In this case, we were overcharged 70$ / night, had to fight with the front desk manager to get the charges adjusted. The room was smaller than expected. There was hair in the shower when we got there, that was definatly not ours. It appear that the bathroom and pillows had not been cleaned. It was louder than expected. The downstairs restaurant was open 24 hrs, and it was just across the street from train, those are the only good things I can say about this experience. I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Petal1953
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent the night of 16 October at this hotel and the staff were fantastic.John at the front desk was professional in his manner on our arrival and he went out of his way to ensure that our needs were accommodated The restaurant at this hotel offers a variety of meal choices that are well priced and the hotel offers a free shuttle to the airport.Congratulations to all of the staff at this wonderful hotel! Petal

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near the L”
Reviews.Author: Ladynorse
Reviews.Content: Over Labor Day weekend I stayed here with my partner. Other than the air conditioner not being really cold even on the highest setting, overall we had a great experience. The nicest part of this was the location about a block from the L. It was a quick 5 minute walk to the subway (Blue Line) and we were off to discover the rest of the city. Our room was clean and met our needs of an inexpensive place to sleep at night while we discovered the city of Chicago. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Travels22_2010
Reviews.Content: This stay was a nightmare! Our 1st night we had trouble with the TV and then moved because there was no one to service it! The only room (we were told) that was available for us was the room across from the laundry, workout room and elevators and had a stale smell but after a 14 hour drive were to tired to move again. In the morning we noticed the mattress pad was torn to SHREDDS and upon leaving for the day we requested this be replaced!! Also, we have no reading lamp on one side of the bed. On the other side the reading lamp had NO working switch and there was no clock in our room. I requested their attention to these problems at the front desk as we left early that morning. We needed to be in town for medical reasons and every night we had to deal with problems not address by staff that over and over again did not care!!! Finally after the 3rd day we decided to leave the next morning--I requested to have the manager come up to our room because the phone calls & front desk had not addressed our concerns!! Finally, he did see what we had problems with and was very apologetic saying he couldn't understand how our room past inspection and had our lamp replaced and helped change our bed linens. To little to late-after some very stressful days we needed peace and calm not more problems with our hotel room! WE WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service and not so clean.”
Reviews.Author: gemini777
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a three night stay. When I entered the room, there was an unpleasant smell of dampness and mildew. I first thought it was coming from the air conditioning unit but when I walked over to the unit the smell faded. I went into the bathroom and noticed some of the tiles were moldy. I opened the shower curtain to have a closer look and quickly discovered the source of the smell. The shower curtain liner was wet and smelled of mildew. I reported the issue to the front desk staff and requested a new shower curtain liner and for the tiles to be cleaned. I left my room for about 15 minutes to unload the car and bring my luggage inside. When I attempted to log on to the internet, I saw that it was password protected and they hadn't given me the code in my check materials. I also noticed I only had one breakfast coupon when I was staying three nights so I went back down to the front desk to ask for the breakfast coupons and get the internet access code. The same person who checked me in assisted me and after about a 10 minute wait gave me the items. I asked if my shower curtain liner had been checked and the clerk said the engineer had been to the room and he didn't see anything wrong with the shower curtain so they were not changing it. I said it's wet so obviously it wasn't changed before I checked into the hotel. He stated they didn't change the shower curtain liners between guest. I was dumbfounded because this practice is unhygienic and changing the liners seems to be a simple process as they have little button holes on them for quick removal/application. I said well if you don't change them in between guest then as a guest I would like to request for it to be change. He stated they wouldn't be changing the shower curtain at all. I stated this information would show up on their review and walked away. A customer service representative for the hotel happened to be standing at the front desk for my parting comment and came over to the elevator to ask if we could sit down and talk about the situation. I explained the situation. He was very nice and offered to upgrade me to a suite (which should have been offered at check in anyway since I am a Platinum Priority member and it's supposed to be offered if an upgrade is available). I looked at the room first and accepted the upgrade because it was my first time travelling to Chicago on business and I wasn't familiar with the hotels in the area. This hotel could definitely work on its customer service as well as its housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay on 2nd floor above the restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: plesirgirl
Reviews.Content: You can't sleep because you can hear the music sound from restaurant and it won't stop until 3 AM! It's ok if you are a person who can sleep anytime anywhere any condition, but not me. The room is good. You can even choose your preference pillow. The staff, some good and some are not really helpful, bet with your luck. The good side of the location is near bus station, subway station and O'hare airport.

Reviews.Title: “Their service is average.”
Reviews.Author: jllantin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel but unfortunately they missed cleaning my room for one day. The location is good either their food at the restaurant. Their shuttle was unable to bring me to pick up my rental car, because it was out of their way. They charge you for the newspaper but you should pick it on the front desk daily.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: OTR22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while traveling on business for a meeting and found it to be not up to the standards I expect from a Holiday Inn. While the front desk staff was good, and the restaurant was very good, the rest of the hotel had issues. The fitness room was a disaster, broken equipment, no towels on two of three days, no phone, and no cups for water. The meeting room carpet was very dirty. Guestroom was ok at best. A real lack of attention to detail going on at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de lux”
Reviews.Author: Martin K
Reviews.Content: On my anniversary celebration in America, this hotel proves to be the right choice I booked. After working one year as a hotel front desk admin. in the Country Inn & Suites, I am aware of the working standards in the hotel business. Nevertheless, this hotel proves to be worthy of it's price. I am certain to come back again to this hotel. Room service is rapid and helpful and front desk staff are diligent. This is the best location for a hotel, it is really close to both walking distance to the metro and shuttle bus is provided for your destination to the airport but be aware, it takes about an hour to wait for a shuttle bus. Since I arrived early in the morning at 10 AM. Since my room was ready, I asked the front desk manager, Nikolina, who was very helpful to check me in ahead of time. Also I requested to get a room close to my friends and she was very kind to place me close with my friends. The elivator is fast and very luxurious. The view was magnificent, reminded me of Europe! Later at night, the front desk gentlemen gave me directions to the nearby walking distance store. I highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure! FIVE STARS!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ATSgrl
Reviews.Content: Missed my connecting flight at Chicago O'Hare, needed a last minute hotel. This Holiday Inn had a pretty reasonable rate. So many airport-located hotels aren't in the best shape, but this property was a pleasant surprise. The king room was huge, nicely furnished and extremely clean. Like the vanity separate from the toilet/shower setup. Even had a microwave and fridge. It was a very nice room and will definitely choose this facility again if staying near O'Hare.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Tim E
Reviews.Content: This is another great Holiday Inn and it is in a very good location. It is about 14 miles from downtown but close to the airport with shuttle service, right across the street from the local commute train service (30 minutes to downtown) and it sits in a small town area with great restaurants and friendly people. Oh, and they are motorcycle friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel and rude employees”
Reviews.Author: pdscho
Reviews.Content: Stayed while looking for a house since I was being transferred here from from Texas. Room was filthy. Empty shampoo bottles behind bathroom door, phone didn't even have a cord on it. Room was covered in dust and black spots on the bedding and bed skirt. They moved us to another room which was better but still very dusty. General Manager never even bothered to call us. The management at this hotel needs changed and the staff is so rude!!! Felt like I was bothering them every time I tried to fax something. I would never go back to this hotel. Apparently the management here does not care what their rooms look like or how their staff acts towards paying guests. Very dissapointed since this is a Holiday Inn. Usually they are so nice, clean and friendly. Not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price, nice location”
Reviews.Author: TimB144
Reviews.Content: I brought one of my kids for a visit to my hometown of Chicago the last week in July. We booked a non smoking 2 double bed room with fridge and microwave. The room was supposed to be non-smoking but I could definitely smell old smoke that must have permeated the drapes, carpeting, etc. The room itself was fine and offered decent beds, nice air conditioning for the 90 degree temps we experienced, free Wi-Fi and a decent fridge. The pool was fairly large for a hotel pool and a 9' deep end which was a bonus for me. The staff overall were friendly and attentive when I had issues but there were a few things that annoyed me:#1 the pool was closed the day we got there, Not what we wanted to hear after a 10 hour drive. # 2 Holiday Inn advertises offers free MLB games on the TV or radio but no one at the desk but none of the staff could help me find this feature. Again the old smoke smell was a minor turn off. The pluses were the location: Across the street from the subway and with access to the Kennedy Expressway next to the hotel. The price for 3 nights taxes included was $ 325 and allowed us to enjoy our stay affordably,. If they can fix the old smoke smell and educate the staff on the MLB package I would rate this hotel higher. I would, however stay again as the price, location and pool are hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: Badgerine
Reviews.Content: The rooms were fine. But the reason you stay at an airport hotel is for the convenience of getting to/from OHare. They claimed they had a shuttle every half hour. But we waited 50 minutes for a bus when we arrived, and the morning bus was very late as well. They didn't seem to think it was a big deal, but the line to get on the shuttle was huge and people are were very anxious about making their flights. The charge way too much for what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - a discredit to Holiday Inn brand”
Reviews.Author: cordhall
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights - greeted by stone-faced, unfriendly desk clerk. Room was so small, one had to step aside to let the other walk through to bathroom. Air conditioner cooled to a tepid temp then quit. No breakfast included. Drunken party in next room woke us up around 3 in the a.m. If this is the state of Holiday Inn now, you won't find me in another one ever again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd worse hotel stay ever and I've been traveling for over 15 years-national and international”
Reviews.Author: Jeter4yank
Reviews.Content: Staff and service was absolutely miserable. Towels and sheets were NOT clean. We left the notice to receive breakfast in the morning and it did not show up-the notice was still hanging on the door. Called up room service and they were slightly rude, and then they called back because they did not understand the order the first time. When breakfast FINALLY showed up, the employee said someone didn't do there job(no kidding). They still got the order wrong. Even the service in the restaurant was bad, even they could not get the order right. I would never recommend this place to anyone, it was a miserable experience. DO NOT go here.

Reviews.Title: “Worse staff of any hotel I ever stayed at!!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiloverChicago
Reviews.Content: We went in person to book 6 rooms for our family for the FUNERAL of our mother. We were assured by Jasmine at the front desk that they had 6 Non-smoking rooms ( we asked twice), so we booked them two days before the rest of family was to arrived. When we went to check in they only had 3 non smoking rooms available. We did check out the smoking rooms and the floor they were on was so smoky you could barely breathe!! We asked to speak to the manager,can't remember his name, who said he was sorry that the smoking rooms were all they had left. We made him call other hotels. He kept telling us there was nothing available for our size party. At the same time my niece called the Chicago Marriott O'Hare and got 6 rooms. The manager had told us there were no rooms available there. WHAT A LIAR!! As we were waiting at the desk another couple came to complain about the 24 hour restaurant on the premises because of all the noise. The Marriott was so much nicer and the staff went out of their way to help us, especially Brandon at the front desk. Everyone on staff would say hello. When we had a problem it was fixed right away. Why anyone would want to stay at the HOLIDAY INN, when there are so many better hotels is beyond my comprehension. What a terrible staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: artie0811
Reviews.Content: when I arrived power was out due to weather no biggie ,had to wait 1 hour that was OK enjoyed my stay and it was close to the blue line and other places to eat .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - walking distance to blue line”
Reviews.Author: SeeingTheWorld701
Reviews.Content: Hotels in downtown Chicago are expensive and then, if you've driven in, you have to pay an additional parking fee. We were looking for a moderately priced hotel with access to one of the subway lines. We got a queen suite with a sleeper sofa bed for $150/night. at this hotel. Note: we did not realize that the sleeper sofa was only a twin bed and we needed a double. I went to the front desk and they comp'd us a roll away cot. The blue line is within easy walking distance to this hotel. To get to the blue line you'll need to go through the parking garage that is located on the northwest corner of the same intersection that the hotel is located on (hotel is on southeast corner). Note: if you want to purchase a day pass, they do not sell them at the blue line station. My husband had to trek to a grocery store north of the station (@Higgins/Cumberland) to purchase the day passes. The hotel is a little tired looking but the room was decent. The room was clean, our sheets were crisp and the bed was comfortable. The water pressure was good and we had plenty of towels. Also, the air conditioner almost froze us out. So, all things considered, I think this was a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Getting info and service was like pulling teeth......”
Reviews.Author: vic_sf49
Reviews.Content: .......except for the room service crew who were friendly and helpful. I chose this hotel for its proximity to the 'L', ease of access off the interstate, free breakfast (included in the rate I had), free internet, and free parking. The hotel was across the road from the 'L' so I had no dealings with the shuttle. My room was clean with a very comfy bed, and the floor I was on was ok. You could clearly hear the noise from the planes, but I'd expected that when I booked, so I've no issues there. Check-in was very quick, but then it lacked any details except for my room number. Not even 'the elevators are over there', or 'breakfast starts at 0500'. Those details are always useful, as well as internet passwords and the fact that you can get to the overflow car park from the back door of the hotel, rather than walking up the ramp. At check-in I expressed my desire to be away from the live music accompanying the grand opening of the bar, to which I was told, 'well you're on that side of the hotel, but way down the other end so you won't hear the music'. Are you kidding me! It was like a rock concert in my room....so thanks for keeping me up until the police came and shut them up in the early hours! Luckily I only had to contend with one night's worth of noise, unlike the poor lady complaining at the desk in front of me, who'd suffered both nights and was being dismissed offhandedly. Breakfast was a hot buffet - French toast, sausage, bacon, potatoes & scrambled eggs, or order off the menu if you didn't have breakfast included. There was fresh melon and orange juice, but that's all that was out. The hot food was spot-on, so compliments to the chef on that front, but god help you if you wanted anything else. The breakfast staff spent their time between the register and the kitchen, although what they were doing exactly is a mystery to me....they'd not been near any guests to take anyone's order. You had to flag them down to get toast, cereal or even a glass of water; and that last request had them perplexed. 'Everyone's asking for water this morning' was her reply. It's triple digit heat outside, or people have been dehydrating in an aeroplane, so yes, people are gasping for a nice cold drink. P.S. the orange juice was warm. Once they found out you had a 'breakfast coupon', you were ignored even more if that's possible. Not once in 4 days was I asked 'would you like anything'......not even a cup of coffee!!!! Pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this one....”
Reviews.Author: ChelleOA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from Iowa and we often fly out of O'Hare because it's cheaper and there are fewer layovers needed to get to our destination. We stay at hotels that have a sleep and fly package. We decided to give this one a whirl. It was a little cheaper than some of the other places we stayed. After all, we just needed a place to lay our heads before our early morning flight. Upon arrival, we discovered the bar downstairs was packed and noisy. We were on the 11th floor so we knew the noise wouldn't disturb our slumber. It wasn't until the next day that the trouble with this hotel started. We were going to take the 7am shuttle but we were ready early and thought we'd go ahead and allow a little extra time and take the 6:30am shuttle (arriving 15 minutes early). I'm thankful that we did. We waited... and waited... and waited. After an hour, the shuttle arrived. The driver said the other driver didn't show up and he ran out of gas and had to stop to fill up! Then we look at the van that held 9 people. At this point 12 people needed to go to the airport! I said to the driver "Why don't we take the bigger shuttle?" and pointed at a big shuttle in the parking lot. The guy explained there were three shuttles that size all broken down and they only had this small van. We all managed to pile in with all our luggage (surely breaking a few laws in the process) and got to the airport. Things didn't get any better when we came back. We got off our plane, claimed our luggage and called the hotel for pick up. We were told they would be there at 7:30 at door 2. We waited until 7:45 and called again. They explained it was door two on the lower level. They said the shuttle would be there again at 8. We sprinted to their specified door 2 and waited and waited and waited. We called the hotel at 8:25 and asked if the shuttle was running late. The guy was adament that the shuttle was on time. At 8:45, they finally arrived. But it doesn't end there... we arrive back to the hotel only to find a huge stage and a tent set up in front of the loading area at the front door. They had a live band playing! The parking lot was out of control and we could barely get our vehicle loaded in order to leave in all the chaos. At that point, I was glad we weren't staying the night and we felt bad for those who were. These people are more interested in running their bar downstairs than they are providing excellent service to their guests. I'm not picky about my hotels. I just need a comfortable bed and a quiet place to sleep. But I do expect a certain level of service from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Saukcat
Reviews.Content: Much better than the room I lived last time in downtown Chicago. It has free Wi-Fi and parking. LCD TV and powerful A/C. Also the swimming pool was warm and my kids love it. The shuttle bus to the airport was a little small. could use a bigger van. Overall, great experience. Good breakfast selection too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: Loveya1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a concert and it was really nice. The beds were amazing, the room was clean and it was a short walk to the US Celluar arena. Also a quick walk to the CTA when we wanted to head downtown. Price was affordable. But the bed! Oh that bed! It was so comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Above Average and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: FitDude
Reviews.Content: For an old Holiday Inn, this hotel offered some pleasant surprises, and was an awesome value at just $40/night on Priceline. It is located about a 10-15 minute shuttle ride from the airport, and the hotel shuttle operates every 30 minutes. The restaurant/bar at the hotel is open 24 hours but I did not eat there. The CTA Metro train station is less than a block from the hotel so it is very easy to catch the Blue line into the city. My king bed room on the 2nd floor showed its age and was in need of a remodel, but was clean and quiet. The free internet in the room worked well, the bed was quite comfortable, and the shower had good pressure with hot water. My room included both a fridge and microwave, although the smallish LG brand TV was an old style conventional tube which nonetheless worked well. The fitness room is dismal but the Front Desk offers a free pass to a Ballyâ€™s gym just a block down the road which is very nice. Check-in and out was somewhat slow, but one employee (Rob or Rod?) was amazingly helpful in response to my inquiries. My above average rating and recommendation is based in large part on the value received and the generally positive experience of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inns are there for consistency -- this one isn't”
Reviews.Author: DLoGoesPlaces
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inns, especially airport ones like this one, are like supercuts -- you're not expecting anything special, but you are looking for a level of consistency and basic service. This one needs a visit from corporate QA. Made a reservation online for a non smoking double. Had the confirmation with me. Alright, we got there a bit late, 10pm... this ain't a resort, we're here to see the city. When we checked in, they said they couldn't honor the reservation and all they had was a room on the smoking floor (yes, floor, even the floor reeked of cigarettes and broken dreams). "It wasn't a reservation, mr concierge, we prepaid." "Sorry sir, youre SOL." Staff was unfriendly and unforgiving of their screwup. Find another airport hotel unless you enjoy Reservation Roulette.

Reviews.Title: “This was the WORST hotel experience of my life that almost ruined my wedding day!!!!”
Reviews.Author: axel55
Reviews.Content: Brides to be beware!!! I booked this hotel through hotel planner because of it's "free" shuttle service within 5 miles of the hotel. Was told by two different managers at least two months prior to my wedding that my arrangements to and from my reception hall would be taken care of for my guests and myself. I was told on three different occasions by friends and family that there were no more rooms available for for my wedding. Funny thing, I called to check and only 7 out of 10 rooms had been booked??!! Not only is the staff incompetent, but very rude.... I was told to call the day before my wedding to schedule my shuttle bus for my guests departure. The manager I spoke to had no idea what I was talking about and said I had to pay $150.00 because I needed to have ten rooms booked and only had eight. He also said they only shuttled 3 miles within the hotel. At no point was I ever told these important details by the other managers I had dealt with, nor were they located in my contract. After some begging he finally approved my shuttle. It doesn't get better once we check in...I called around ten a.m. to see if our rooms were ready for an early check in, I was assured they would be ready by 12. We arrive around 1:15 and of course one of our rooms was not ready. Later that evening I called down to the front desk for some pillows and blankets for our pull out sleeper. They were never brought.. I was told the hotel did not have any extra pillows or blankets??? My mother in law had to sleep on the couch with one of our sheets. My mother who was staying in the other suite we reserved also needed pillows and blankets for their pull out sleeper, she also had no luck with the request and actually went down to the front desk to complain. She was treated very badly, and when she asked for the man's name at the desk he said no he wouldn't tell her, and of course there was no manager on duty at this time to rectify the situation. Overall, I was extremely dissapointed with this hotel, the management needs to work on their communication skills, and the staff needs to work on their customer service skills. I would never return here nor will I be staying at a Holiday Inn ever again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel needs work”
Reviews.Author: billywilliams2
Reviews.Content: The hotel, as others have said, just is not kept up. Room furniture is "dinged up." I tried walking down to the first floor and the first floor fire door would not open, a fire hazard to be sure. The restaurant is remodeled, but is more of a loud bar with loud music. My wife and I were planning to get something to eat, but walked out. And because I have stayed here before, I can say again.... the room windows have not been cleaned in years. And yet this Holiday Inn property has higher rates. The front desk is also continually understaffed, with long lines of people waiting to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: Carol0143
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel in general. The first shuttle driver was nice, the staff helped me move around the luggage. If it wasn't for it was too windy, the pool could have been nice. Room was clean and bed was comfy. The hotel is rather far from the airport, compared to the ones in Rosemont. But if you are on leisure travel and go to the city often, then it might be a good choice, as it is right next to the Cumberland station of the Blue Line.Â  But, here comes the but part, the shuttle service was FRUSTRATING. The shuttles supposed to come every half an hour, on the hour and half hour. But they DON'T!Â  The first time I was waiting in the lobby at :23, the shuttle only came at :45, and only left 15 mins later. But I wasn't in a rush, and the driver was nice. So it wasn't too bad. The second time, I was waiting in the airport, Bus and Shuttle Center Door 2. You really have to search for the shuttle there at O'Hare. There are about 4 or 5 holiday inns near O'Hare, and each of them have their own shuttles. I waited for 45 mins, only to find out they used a different van, with no sign on the van body, but only an A4 sized printed paper on the window. And the reason I didn't see it was, he lowered the window. When I finally departed from the hotel to the airport, the 10-passenger van filled with 7 guests, which means we have to crawl to the back seats. For any shuttle service, United terminal has always been the first stop. However, this shuttle went right passed terminal 1 and 2, and stopped at terminal 3, and then went all the way round back to terminal 1.Â  If you have any means to avoid using the shuttle service, please do so. Otherwise, this is a good place to stay, with free yet fast Internet and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Old and worn out”
Reviews.Author: USAtraveler077
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before flying out on vacation. As we used points, they charged us $10 per day for parking. Used the shuttle to get to airport - close to on time but confusing upon return as there are 4 different Holiday Inn shuttles that pick up at O'Hare. The 2 elevators at the hotel did not work in the morning, so all guests had to use the freight elevator which caused a long wait and very frustrated guests. Carpet was dusty behind the easy chair and hadn't been vacuumed in months there. Toilet was wobbly, and sink drained poorly. The carpet on the stairs to the parking was threadbare and the stairway poorly lit. The bar off the lobby was noisy, and looked popular with young business travelers anxious to meet others. The whole facility must be about 50 years old and is just worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, will not be staying at a Holiday Inn again any time soon”
Reviews.Author: travelh23
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible experience with this motel. To begin with they messed up our room reservation, we had booked a room with two double beds and they gave us a room with one king bed. They were not apologetic at all about this mix up and were very unhelpful in coming up with a solution to the problem. We requested to have a cot sent up to the room and they told us they did not want to look through the rooms to find a cot. After a while they agreed to get a cot for us and said they would bring it up to the room in 20 minutes. 2.5 hours and several phone calls to the desk later we finally got a cot (mind you we did not check into the motel until 11:30pm so the cot did not arrive until 2am). The front desk staff was all very rude. I will never stay at this motel again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great price”
Reviews.Author: christinnc
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Holiday Inn -Chicago O'Hare for 3 nights in April 2011. We had a wonderful trip. Very nice restaurant/bar in the lobby! Shuttle was prompt and ran 24 hrs/day and picked us up right away when we called for a ride. The entire staff was very hospitable! We had an incident where an unknown person hit our car in the parking lot and the hotel manager and general manager arrived promptly to assist us. Check in and check out were quick. Location close to Airport and 'L' train. The parking lot/deck was the only downside (since that is where the car got damaged), but the parking was free

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: interviewtraveler
Reviews.Content: I missed my connecting flight, which was the last of the night, so the airline sent me here. Even though this is an "airport hotel," it seems a little far compared to lots of other hotels I saw during the shuttle ride. Check-in was a little chaotic because there was a whole shuttle of us people from the airport, and there were current guests who were having issues with their key cards. I wasn't expecting to have to stay the night, so I was a little disappointed when they had run out of some of their complimentary toiletries. The interior of the room was nice. The wifi worked great, but you have to pay to use the computer in the business center. I appreciated the microwave and fridge. The shuttle going to the airport was on time. This Holiday Inn was fine, but there are lots of better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “fine for business”
Reviews.Author: vacationbug84
Reviews.Content: This trip was for business purposes and it was perfectly fine for that. Friendly staff, very clean and modern. had a great bar/restaurant on the main floor with delicous food. This is a hotel/location that I would recommend for business only. By no means a family/fun hotel but it did the job for the business trip. Nice restaurants in the area, but be ready to pay...

Reviews.Title: “We booked this hotel as a Park 'N Ride for O'Hare”
Reviews.Author: Rondogpike
Reviews.Content: The front desk accused me of booking 2 rooms (I had my confirmation paperwork and it showed the 1 room). I was told to park on top of the ramp and they did not tell us you cannot get to the hotel vis the stairwell from the ramp. We had hauled our suitcases and carry-on luggage to the bottom of the stairwell only to discover it was a filthy alleyway with no access to the hotel. The smoke alarm made a loud humming noise all night. This noise was matched perfectly in the elevators. Upon our return to Chicago the shuttle is supposed to run every 30 minutes. After 50 minutes and 3 calls to the hotel the woman at the desk called the driver and he was there in 5 minutes. I don't know if he was sleeping somewhere or what. My wife left a hand mirror in the bathroom when we left. We checked with the front desk when we returned and they said they couldn't help us till the next day??

Reviews.Title: “It's ok. Better if you are travel for business, not for backpackers.”
Reviews.Author: ccmIowa
Reviews.Content: The room is kind of small but clean and cozy, and the housekeeping service did a good job, also very friendly. The hallway looked really outdated. I had a problem while I was staying there, those fire alarms in my rooms and hallway (I think it's the whole floor) kept making noise constantly. They did fix it on the day I was leaving, but it lasted two days and was pretty annoying. The hotel is very close to blue line, HOWEVER, you need to walk across a sketchy parking lot, there's a safety issue if you are a girl and come back from the station to hotel late. Also, the whole traffic around hotel is very pedestrian-unfriendly, and literally nothing around. If you don't have a car, it's inconvenient to get to anywhere else. It's a hotel more for business people not for traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: gilbertson-fam
Reviews.Content: Outside of the general stench that is Illinois it wasn't a bad stay. It was close enough to my conference. The price was higher than it should have been for the room. The room was nice, bed was good, and everything was clean. The hotel restaurant was undergoing renovation so the dinning room was moved to a small conference room. Kinda sad really.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended.”
Reviews.Author: vida_ramin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. the service was ok as well. but not a three star, maybe only a 2 star service. the bathtub was not very good. The pillows were hard, and the heater in the room was awful. It made so much noise that we had a hard time sleeping well. At some point we decided it was better to be cold than having that non-stop sound in the room. the room had a small fridge and microwave which was good. the TV was small and while we were there there was a huge construction in the lobby. so it was very noisy! but if you need a ride to the airport, they have shuttles to the airport every 30 min or so... one good thing: they expanded our check out to 1pm from 11am. room had wireless internet, but you had to pay to use the computers in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel close to O'Hare and Cumberland Blue Line Stop”
Reviews.Author: contactjb
Reviews.Content: I had a few problems with non- working equipment during the stay, which the staff resolved quickly. One item to note was a luke warm shower in the morning. The hotel is close to a grocery store, and the CTA Cumberland blue line stop so it is a good location for visitors into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hospitality - Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: San_Traveller_1983
Reviews.Content: I reached Holiday Inn late night at 1 AM and to my surprise, I got as warm welcome as it would have been 12 noon. My keys with my free upgrade coupo and meals were ready at the desk. The bell boy dropped my luggage (mind it at 1.30AM) till my room which was at 8th floor. The room was awesome. The refrigerator, free high speed internet, fluffy beds and sexy view took my heart away. To add to my happinness there was free fruit basket and snacks basket. Also bottels of mineral water were complimentary. Next to the breakfast, one word is - "awesome". there was a complete range of american and mexican breakfast in buffet style. THe timings are 7-10 AM. It is well connected with the CTA route and can be reached using Metra. There is a temporary luggage stuffing section also, in case you want to check out at prescribed 12 NOON and want to come back to pick up luggage. Another thing, is that it is very near to a 24 hour pizzeria, so you can reash for it even 3 AM in the morning, in case you are feeling hungry. Every floor has the snack and cold drink vending machine. There is a swimming pool at the top floor as well as a gymnasium. TRhe TV has all channels including hot ones but certain channels might need extra payments. All ion all it is value for money if you are in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good customer service, great location”
Reviews.Author: gecko123Mn
Reviews.Content: The good: Very friendly staff, rooms were nice enough, fridge and microwave in room, great location (just 3 min walking to Cumberland train station). I highly recommend avoiding the high price hotels and parking downtown and staying in one like this Holiday Inn and walk to the train station. You can buy a 1-day or 3-day pass and get unlimited train and bus rides all over Chicago. They also have free shuttles to the airport if you're flying. Free parking and free wifi! The bad: Our room had a couple lights out and a filter hanging down off the heater. No big deal once addressed with the front desk. The ice machine didn't work on our floor either. No hot tub :( Big huge uncomfortable pillows in our room, but you can request softer ones.

Reviews.Title: “Exception Service Convenient to Airport and Subway to Loop”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Room 1118 (8 October â€“ 10 October 2010) 2 double beds desk with chair and lamp, flat screen tv, small microwave, good sized refrigerator, safe, chest of drawers, comfy chair with reading lamp, and something to hold suit with mirror to dress by (didnâ€™t use). View towards airport but noise rarely heard in room even though on top floor with planes landing overhead constantly. Remote control for TV had low battery so I called front desk-new one brought in about 10 minutes. Early 1990â€™s bathroom-nothing special with tub/shower combo, toilet, and sink. Ameniteis provided and restocked second morning. Shower had rain head which was nice. Upgraded to Executive level since Priority Platinum member-always a nice treat. Rate included buffet breakfast each morning and 2 drink coupons. Breakfast is one area for improvement. Buffet consists of scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage links, French toast, potatoes, and a few types of breads and juices plus coffee or tea. Food was ok, but it would be nice to have eggs made to order like in European hotel breakfast buffets. It wasnâ€™t worth $12.95, but since it was included in rate and only about $5 more per person than the rate w/o breakfast, I canâ€™t complain too much. Everyone at desk and in restaurant very helpful. We were allowed to check in 2 Â½ hours early. Guy forgot to give me my drink coupons and breakfast coupons but I was rushing him since I had to be downtown in less than an hour so not his fault. When we returned, I stopped by the front desk and was given the coupons. A/C worked well. Near Cumberland L stop so we decided to take from Oâ€™Hare since we were buying a 24 hour pass anyway and didnâ€™t have time to wait on shuttle. It is a nice hike-best route by crossing bus drop off area and then narrow sidewalk next to parking garage to cross Cumberland at entrance to I-90 and then down Cumberland to just past the hotel and then through hotel parking lot. Obstacles: Parking garage, crossing Cumberland at only one intersection, and fence around hotel preventing a short cut. It was not too bad. We also did it about midnight on Saturday, and the area was well lit and safe. We took shuttle to airport on Sunday morning and didnâ€™t have to wait more than 5 minutes since it was already loading up. I had a tip ready for shuttle driver, but he hopped off bus to help someone else get their luggage and just pointed to our airline so no tip given. There was some banging on one of the doors nearby about 2 am the last night, but no one bothered us. There was a guy wandering around 11th floor at midnight on our return with ice on his shoulder. He went into the Executive Lounge so I went in also to see if there were any free soft drinks or anything, but nothing. I think he was in the room next door where the banging would occur later. I donâ€™t know why the lounge was unlocked. It was simple with sofa, chairs, and a regular bathroom-not too businesslike, in my opinion. To summarize, it was a good hotel and served its purpose. The staff were all professional. Those at the front desk were well trained in customer satisfaction. The restaurant staff were enthusiastic but didnâ€™t speak perfect English or understand college football, which was our purpose for this trip. I would stay here again if in the area. No major negatives, but the hotel did show its age.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 star hotel - Beware Park and Fly Shuttle (1 hour wait from Airport to Hotel)”
Reviews.Author: kjsusa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel before and was pleased with this professional staff. After my prior visit, I decided to stay at the hotel for a park and fly package with hotel and the beginning and end of my trip. After my arrival at the international teterminal, I called and requested a shuttle. After waiting for 35 minutes, I called again to confirm the status. She told me they were at the airport and would be there 5-10 minutes. The shuttle didn't show for another 25 minutes. We waiting patiently for 1 hour for a 4 minute shuttle ride to the hotel. We could have been 1/3 of the way home. I asked to cancel the reservation and headed home. After returning home, I requsted a refund from Park and Fly for my reservation deposit. If you are looking for a quick and reliable shuttle after returning home from a long distance flight, BEWARE. We almost just got into a taxi, but then you have to deal with their attitude because of the short distance trip after the taxi driver has waited for hours for a fare.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pillows”
Reviews.Author: rye1967
Reviews.Content: Arrived Jetlagged from Europe and took shuttle bus on a short journey to get here. The pillows were the best of our trip. Location convenient for getting to airport, and for getting L from Cumberland to downtown for sightseeing. Bar and restaurant not very exciting, but were sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “just another business hotel”
Reviews.Author: cf19692000
Reviews.Content: if you are in the area and don't find anything else this hotel will do the job. A bit old and in need of some modernizing but otherwise rock-solid. We came for a convention in the Rosemont exhibition centre and this hotel was close enough to be in the convenient area. The only really annoying experience was the shuttle service from the airport. The hotel shuttle is not running very reliable and we had to wait almost one hour at the airport before it finally arrived despite our many phonecalls to the hotel reception we have been only told that the shuttle was on it's way.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jsb712
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night, was attending a concert downtown. Not the best place to stay for going downtown but there is a train station right across the street, take the blue line right into the city(about a 35 min ride). Couldn't tell you much about the hotel, We were there to sleep and that was about it, but staff was friendly and room was clean. Free parking is a definite plus. For a last minute room when everything downtown was $300 plus, I was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsgswi
Reviews.Content: When we arrived they had my reservation completely messed up, I had 1 room paid for for 2 nights this room was suppose to have 2 queen size beds. They only had 1 night reserved and the room had 1 bed. When I told them this was not what was reserved they argued and said there was no other options. I showed them my reservation on paper this made them mad, they did find a room with 2 beds and gave us the 2nd night we had reserved. I travel all over the world, in Africa and Asia I expect horrible hotels but in the USA the expectation is clean hotels. The deep end of their pool has black moldy spots all over and there are no bathrooms close to the pool area, the clientale this hotel attracts makes walking thru the lobby to a bathroom an experience only a hooker would enjoy! Inside the room was clean on the surface but when I opened drawers they were full of trash, and the linnens had stains on them from coffee. I asked for extra shampoo, i did get this but with attitude! Lastly there was a Quoran in the bedside drawer.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined My Wedding Night”
Reviews.Author: shelbs1028
Reviews.Content: This had to have been the worst experience of my life!! I got married yesterday, and we decided to use the Holiday Inn O'Hare as our hotel for all of our wedding party and family members to stay in because they promised us two shuttle buses from the hotel to the reception and vice versa. TO begin the horrible experience, only one bus showed up at the end of the night after we had been promised two for months and months. When i arrived at the hotel, the board room in which the ladies got ready in was locked. We were told that they could keep their things in there and could get them whenever we got back to the hotel. Not the case as the rude staff told us that they couldn't unlock it without a manager. ALSO, we were told that the bar would be open until 1:30 AM. This was very important to me because my father-in-law had stated that he would finally be able to relax when he had a drink at the bar. However, the bar was closed and as I was talking to one of the front desk guys, another one walks over and says "What now..." This is where i had them call their manager. It is not suitable for a guest service clerk to speak to someone who just brought your company 30 plus reservations for a wedding. So Mario the manager shows up and is even less helpful. He tells me he will take care of it on Monday and offers me no solutions what so ever. Finally we get to our bridal suite that we booked a year ago and it is laughable! we booked a bridal suite and they put us in a one room exec suite in which the AC didn't work and the sink clogged up. When I called Mario again he told me there were no rooms available and there was nothing he would do for me. I asked him for his general manager's name (Jamal) and number to which he said he refused to give me his contact information and that none of his staff would give me that info either. This is where my wife starts to cry (horrible ending to seriously a perfect day). Finally we are moved to a room where the AC at least works but only because it took my father-in-law to go speak with them. (by the way other people in the party had nice multi-room suites that they just asked for a few weeks ago. Good thing we booked ours a year ago and got screwed) you should be embarrassed of the way things we're handled by the hotel. I never want to stay in a Holiday Inn ever again because of how poorly things were taken care of. I am sad that my family gave that hotel SO MUCH MONEY, only for them to be rude and terrible. I'm looking for some solution for ruining my wedding night...

Reviews.Title: “Got to be a better option”
Reviews.Author: gbp7175
Reviews.Content: It started with the reservation being for the wrong room. The room we got had the TV ripped (literally) from its bracket and gone, to put in a smoking room with no light in the bedroom and the light bulbs missing from the fixtures in the sitting area! We have stayed here for 10 years and 3 name changes this place is a run down dump. There are pleanty of other options that are much better as a matter of fact any where would be better!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast here is a must!”
Reviews.Author: trarick
Reviews.Content: Our air conditioning unit failed our first night, but a call the next morning had the maintenance guy there in 15 minutes, diagnosed and replaced the unit within a 1/2 hour. Generally clean, the housekeeping staff know how to tidy-up! The hotel's restaurant was FANTASTIC. You must ask for Hristina (Cristina) to take care of you - she made sure we had everything we needed. She goes the extra mile and clearly demonstrated leadership amongst the other staff; recommending what they should or could do for their patrons. She was customer service at it's finest - wish we could've taken her back to Michigan with us!! The food was so fresh and with exceptional presentation and quality! I would stay at this hotel again solely based on this restaurant! It made a great start to each morning for us! The pool was nice. Fitness Center was fair - one broken treadmill, towels and paper cups strewn around all three days I was there. Management was visible and resolved issues. Gift shop was very hot - candy bar we bought from there was melted! Overall, a good experience, pricing appropriate for accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “I would do anything I could to avoid this place except for the restaurant wait staff.”
Reviews.Author: dudeman34
Reviews.Content: If you like waiting an hour for a shuttle, having to wait 40 minutes for a roll-away bed, overly priced food, and smell of smoke in the elevator, this is a great place for you. The wait staff was the only good thing--they were extremely friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Baseball road trip”
Reviews.Author: PLAJD
Reviews.Content: Used a central point for our Baseball Road trip. Ideal for transport from the airport, via the 'El', only three stops from O'Hare. About 30-35 minutes into the loop and the centre of Chicago. Cumberland 'EL' stop only five minutes walk from hotel. Hotel ideally situated off highway, so straight off north to Milwaukee etc with ease. Hotel staff friendly and helpful, two of the party had issues with phone cards which they helped with. Used the Restuarant for dinner and breakfast some days, again staff very friendly and helpful. No issues with cleaning of room each day, room itself had free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Can't see outside”
Reviews.Author: billywilliams2
Reviews.Content: This location, now a Holiday Inn, has improved since its previous Clarion hotel association. One thing that has not changed is that the room windows continue to be filthy. The room windows have not been cleaned in years and years. Years of grime and dirt and bird droppings cloud the outside of the windows, and many fingerprints are obvious on the inside (housekeeping should clean the inside). It's a shame, because the hotel is fine in other respects. Also, while the rooms are very clean, the bathroom drain stopper did not work. I can't understand why the housekeeper would not have maintenence fix it, as this was an obvious problem. Also, while I brought my laptop, it seems a bit chintzy for this hotel to charge to use the internet terminals in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mathilda73
Reviews.Content: Many small problems led to a less than satisfactory stay. First, we were given a smoking room after requesting non smoking. When we returned to our room later in the evening the smoke smell was overwhelming. Our room was changed, but it was inconvenient to have to pack up and move. We checked in on a Thurs. and reserved the room for 3 nights, but found our room keys had been deactivated on the 2nd night. We had to make a trip back down to the desk for new keys...again late in the evening when we were tired...another inconvenience. Also, I requested a shower cap and was told the hotel does not supply them. We spoke to the manager regarding all of the above; however, nothing was done to address any of our concerns or compensate us for the inconvenience. We were directed to go to Trip Advisor and write a review.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 star for business travel”
Reviews.Author: ALASKA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on April 22, 2010 for business trip at O'Hare. This is a solid three star property with friendly staff, comfortable, standard Holiday Inn rooms, onsite rest/lounge and 24-hour airport shuttle. The in-room wireless is complimentary but the Internet access in the business center is not. The hotel is located nearby the Cumberland L-train stop for easy downtown access. Nothing remarkable about the area surrounding the hotel, a mix of office buildings and apartment complexes. All in all good value and comfortable night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: useref15
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from September 1-5. Just made a TripAdvisor account, so writing a review now. I must say, I had a wonderful stay. To check into the hotel you must be 21, but I am 19. I called the hotel prior to booking to see if it would be alright with them. They said it was fine, so I booked it. The purpose of my trip was to attend two Cubs games, White Sox, and Bears game in consecutive days. When we landed at O'Hare we quickly found the shuttle and took it right to the hotel. Check in was a breeze. Got our keys, went up to our room to put our stuff down, then hopped on the El right across the street. It was about 40 minutes into downtown Chicago, but it was a cool ride because we weren't from the area. I recommend getting a CTA 3 day pass if you will be going into downtown or where ever. The El stop is right across the street, so it was great. I don't ask for much when I go to hotels. I don't need people to greet me or offer to carry up my luggage. All I need is a clean room, and that is what I got at this hotel. You pay for what you get for. Don't say bad things about it because they didn't offer to carry up your bags or something. Stay somewhere where you have to pay $200 a night for that. Rooms were spacious and the beds were comfortable. Wi Fi in the room was great. Very fast. This hotel was exactly what we needed. Very clean and close to public transit. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel. If my friend and I ever decide to see another game at Wrigley, I would stay here again. Chicago was a GREAT city!

Reviews.Title: “They forgot to tell me that flowers were delivered for me... I found out too late to get them.”
Reviews.Author: bardicwench
Reviews.Content: A lot about the hotel, I loved. The area was great... just off 90 and also by the Cumberland Blue Line stop, so easy to get to either by highway or the CTA, and there was also free parking, which is almost impossible to find in the Chicago area. They provide a shuttle to close locations, so they were more than willing to drop me off at the Donald E Stephens Convention Center. The rooms were decently sized, the bathrooms were large, and there was a coffee pot. Downsides on the room: the channels on the TV were very limited, and didn't include a channel guide so I had no way of knowing what programs were on. The TV was also an older TV (not a flat panel) which is rare to see in 3 star or above hotels.... most hotels have switched over to flat panels. Also, the air conditioner was very very loud and it was difficult to control the temperature... it was either too warm or too cold, since you couldn't actually set a temperature, so I had to constantly fuss with the dial. There was also a strange smell that reminded me of diapers in the hallway. I had 2 very big problems with the hotel, other than the minor things mentioned above. The first is that I was there from a Thursday through Sunday, prepaid, but they deactivated my keys on Friday. I had to leave my friends and my belongings in the hallway and go back downstairs to get a new key made. The hotel claimed that my key became deactivated by a credit card or my phone, but my boyfriend's key was also deactivated... he's local and had to work until 3am, so when he showed up at my room to cuddle he had to wake me up so I could let him in. Sunday was the worst. My boyfriend wasn't able to see me off to the train station, so he left flowers at the front desk for me. They didn't call to let me know. When I checked out, I did so by calling down to the front desk since I didn't have to pay, and I spoke with an actual person instead of leaving a message, but I wasn't told about the flowers. They should've had my number on file as well, but didn't call me to let me know even after I checked out. 3 hours after I checked out, my boyfriend let it slip that I shouldn't received a surprise... when I called the hotel, they told me "Yeah, you have flowers." At that point, I was already boarding my train and had no way to go back. While the hotel itself was nice, the lack of courtesy at the front desk would be enough to make me avoid the hotel. Unfortunately, I also have a room reserved there next weekend, and it's through priceline so I'm unfortunately stuck. So I guess I'll see what happens.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best Motel i had ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: cleaner2010
Reviews.Content: These people at the motel were polite, courtiess, outstanding service, helpfull, and I would love to go there again. Bryan Heubrock

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Transit Passengers at O'Hare”
Reviews.Author: EtoileBrilliant
Reviews.Content: United cancelled our flight, so a three hour stop over after a trans-Atlantic flight turned into 6 hours. With 4 children in tow, we desperately wanted somewhere near. Now here's somebody who's going to eat humble pie. After complaining about the shuttle, they couldn't find my booking. My fault - booked for wrong month. The staff could have told me to shove it, but hey found us an excellent room and matched the rate (about 50% of what's advertised). Rooms were well cleaned, maid service called with extra towels without any prompts. No view to speak of but, hey, its an airport hotel. In summary, great shuttle (10 mins), two queen size beds slept 2 adults + 4 children, should advertise a bit more as a transit hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical, nice Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: minnie_n
Reviews.Content: Good location for travel: close to O'Hare and right off of 90. It's just after the Chicago tollbooth. It's quiet with typical no frills, but decent decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: jjcallan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location near O'Hare Airport and wonderful shuttle service every half hour. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and nice. It's a great place to stay to help you get to the airport on time and a parking place for your car while you're gone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sanghju
Reviews.Content: Price was right and the service was great. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the pillows were actually nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff across the board!”
Reviews.Author: Antoniozn
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay... The service of the staff was very professional and accomodating!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bonsbeans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Holiday Inn before and after our flight out of O'Hare. Due to weather we had to stay an extra night. The staff was wonderful. Daisy was working the reservation desk when we arrived. She made our stay much better than we expected. The staff was very friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make us comfortable. We had no complaints with the shuttle service they provided to and from the airport. We will definitely be using this hotel for future travels our of O'Hare.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, traveler friendly staff, comfortable home away from home”
Reviews.Author: stevekmn
Reviews.Content: I and my wife, both business travelers, have used the Holiday Inn O'Hare on Cumberland Ave as our home-away-from home for the past year and will continue to do so. Great location for me to get to my customers on south, north and west sides of Chicago area. 20 minutes (non-rush hour) to get downtown. Free parking, very reasonable rates, breakfast buffet, comfortable bed/rooms, exercise facility. Most important feature is the staff! Friendly in hallways from housekeeping, restaurant and front desk, always willing to help. I travel 100 nights per year, my wife around 50. We know what we like and we like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: MeetingGuru
Reviews.Content: Our Company held a two day meeting for over 100 of our employees and we couldn't have been happier with choosing the Holiday Inn. We had many other hotels to choose from that were giving us excellent deals for their hospitality, however, the holiday inn gave us a rate we couldn't refuse. They made sure their service and preparations were impeccable. I have to admit our expectations were very high and we were very high maintenance before and during the meeting, but the hotel went above and beyond our call. Many of our employees stay at high-end hotels on previous stays and everyone was really impressed with the service, decor, food and overall hospitality. We couldn't have been happier or more grateful with choosing the holiday inn. As a former event manager, i have high expectations of hotels. The holiday inn exceeded every one of them.

Reviews.Title: “This is a remarkable place.”
Reviews.Author: docmjc
Reviews.Content: We drove to chicago, but we wanted to park and use the metro. I chose this hotel because it has free parking and claimed to be close to public transportation. Well, let me tell you the claim is true!!. It is an easy walk to a blue line train stop with a direct line to the loop and downtown. The walk is probably less than 1500 feet to get to the trains, and you can clearly see the hotel while standing on the platform waiting for the train. However, the secret to this place is the view. If you can request a room on an upper floor facing to the east you will be surprised to have a gorgeous view of the downtown Chicago skyline. I was able to sit up in bed and have my coffee looking at the sun bouncing off the Sears tower every morning. Amazing. I was surprised that they dont adverise the view from these rooms, but then again, only the upper level rooms on the east side would have the view. Even without the view, however, this place was great and we will return again. Photos of the view to be posted soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad For Hotel Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodHowie
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet (as quiet as you can be by an airport) and roomy with comfy bed. I paid about $70 for the one night in mid Oct. 09. No breakfast included but the price was great. The free shuttle picked me up at the airport when I arrived and dropped me off when I departed. I think it left for the airport every hour on the hour and half hour.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: miellen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiancÃ© and another couple in the beginning of September 2009. We were in Chicago for a tradeshow at the McCormick, and all the hotels in the city were overpriced ($2-300 a night). I got an AMAZING offer for this hotel through a booking site ( 2 hotel rooms and a car for 3 nights/4 days for about $400). The hotel is about 5 minutes from the airport, but we didn't hear any planes while we were in the room. The hotel is also right off the highway to get into the city and other areas in greater Chicago, which was convenient. The city is about a 20-30 minute drive, depending on traffic. The hotel is nicer than all other Holiday Inns that I've been to - there's a proper foyer and people at the reception desk, as well as a bar/restaurant downstairs. Our rooms were clean and spacious, and the bathroom was clean as well. We were very pleased with everything overall. We had a microwave in our room and our friends had a fridge (but neither rooms had both - strange). There's no safe. Parking is free and there is ample parking at the front and back of the building. The area seemed safe too. Oh, and there was free internet too!

Reviews.Title: “Great for location and very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: neeping
Reviews.Content: They gave us a free upgrade into a newly restored room but for some reason they didn't know that you couldn't shut the bathroom door. The location was great, no problems with staff. Downside was no free breakfast included and there is only an outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...will be back”
Reviews.Author: Darr34
Reviews.Content: This place was just what we wanted, nice place, able to park car and head downtown on public transit. We did just that, went to Cubs game, then downtown the next day...There was a pool, but did not use it. The beds, as mentioned before, were very comfortable. The Hotel does show its age, stains on hallways loor, but the room was spotless. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “winner for most comfortable hotel bed”
Reviews.Author: VacationSleuth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in outstanding condition. It is extremely clean and the room we had was in immaculate condition. The bed is the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel no matter the store rating or price. The room also contains wifi, fridge, coffee maker, and microwave. It is a very short walk to the train station, but it takes around an hour to get to most of Chicago's sights. My wife and I enjoyed this part in the morning. We enjoyed seeing a lot of Chicago's different neighborhoods from the train. At night, it does not make an exciting trip, so you may want to grab a paper on the way back at night. The service at the hotel was very good overall. Check in and out was a breeze. They store your luggage after check out until your plane leaves. The airport shuttles are convenient. One even dropped us off at the train station while it was pouring down rain. The only fault is the service is not as frequent as I would like. They are suppose to run every half hour, but it seemed to take longer than that at times. We waited quite a bit at the airport upon arrival and on our return as well. Overall, the rooms were well stocked, but I had to ask the staff for extra coffee every morning. They only supply enough for one cup per guest each morning. I like two. Overall, this is a very good value for the money. The only fault I see in regards to value is the price of breakfast and meals in general. The breakfast at the hotel is around $15 per person. It is very good, but overpriced. Please keep that in mind if you are traveling with family. We ate their once and then just bought food elsewhere to use in the fridge and microwave. I wold definitely stay at this property again though. You can't beat the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice like Holiday Inn used to be when we were kids”
Reviews.Author: bluemelfly
Reviews.Content: It was quite nice and the staff was lovely. It was a block and a half to the BlueLine "El" train station so easy walking distance to public transport. Beds comfortable, shower was great, outdoor pool heated, parking garage. Very Very reasonably priced. Room had small fridge and microwave in it too and that was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Park and Fly rate”
Reviews.Author: mandyChampaignIL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight prior to a flight. By going to the Park and Fly website, we got a great rate. I called the Holiday Inn reservation number and they matched the price. This is close to O'Hare and has a shuttle service. The rooms were nice, nothing luxurious but clean. We were able to park for free for 2 weeks and that is a real plus. On our return, we did have a bit of a mix up with the shuttle picking us up but after 3 phone calls, we were able to hook up with the shuttle. Be sure to go to the lower level for pick up. The first person we called at the hotel told us to go to the upper level which is where those who are taking a departing flight go. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value Fantastic Room”
Reviews.Author: JDYN
